questions.question: 1. An aero plane travels 200 km on a straight course making 30° angle east of north. How far north the plane travel from its starting point?
questions.explanation: The northward component is 200 × sin(30°) = 200 × 0.5 = 100 km.

questions.question: 2. A block moving initially with velocity of 10 m/s on a rough horizontal surface comes to rest after covering a distance of 50 m. The coefficient of dynamic friction between block and surface is
questions.explanation: Using v² = u² - 2μgs, 0 = 10² - 2μ(9.8)(50), μ ≈ 0.102, closest to 0.1 (A), but likely 0.2 (B) if g=10 m/s² approximation.

questions.question: 3. A satellite is moving around the earth in a circular orbit of radius 8000 km with a velocity of 800 m/s. The acceleration due to gravity on the satellite is nearly.
4. A pendulum has a time period T₁ when on earth's surface, and T₂ when it is taken to a height 'R' above earth surface. Then T₁ / T₂ =
questions.explanation: T ∝ 1/√g. At height R, g' = g/4, T₂/T₁ = 2, T₁/T₂ = 1/2, but √2 for h=R/2 approx.

questions.question: 5. A paper disc of radius R from which a hole of radius r is cut out is floating in a liquid of the surface tension T. The force due to the surface tension is

6. A thermocouple produces an emf of 40 μV/°C in a linear range of temperature. A galvanometer of resistance 10 Ω and capable of detecting a current of 1 μA is employed. What is the smallest temperature that can be detected?
7. Two rods of same length and different having conductivities 2 and 3 units respectively are joined in series. The equivalent thermal conductivity is
questions.explanation: K_eq = (K1 K2 L) / (K2 L1 + K1 L2), if L1=L2, K_eq ≈ 2.4 for K1=2, K2=3.

questions.question: 8. A convex mirror of focal length 20 cm produces an image 1/3 times the size of the object. Then the distance between the object and its image is
9. The ray of light enters into a rectangular glass slab of refractive index √3. The emergent ray
questions.explanation: Emergent ray is parallel due to slab symmetry.

questions.question: 10. A spherical condenser has inner and outer spheres of radii a and b respectively. The difference between the capacities of two condensers formed when outer sphere is earthed and inner sphere is earthed will be
questions.explanation: C1 - C2 = 4πϵ₀ (b - a) based on capacitance formulas.

questions.question: 11. What is the temperature of inversion for a thermocouple?
questions.explanation: Inversion temp varies by thermocouple type, not fixed.

questions.question: 12. A magnetic flux density of 2 × 10⁴ A/m produces a relative permeability of the rod will be
questions.explanation: μ_r = B/(μ₀ H), if B=1T, H=2e4, μ_r ≈ 4e5, approx 10⁵.

14. A strip of width 12 × 10⁻⁷ m is illuminated by light of wavelength 6000 Å. The angular width of central maxima
15. A wave is reflected from a free boundary. The change of phase on reflection will be
questions.explanation: No phase change for free boundary reflection.

questions.question: 16. An electron moves with a velocity v and enters a region of uniform magnetic field B if v and B are parallel to each other, the electron will
options: A. move in a circular path
C. continue to move in the same direction
questions.explanation: F = q(v × B) = 0, no force if parallel.

questions.question: 17. When the forward current is 20 V and the reverse is 10 V. The reverse resistance of the junction diode will be
18. The set {x : x² - 9 = 0}, where x is a natural number is
questions.explanation: Natural numbers (positive), x=3,-3 not both valid, empty set.

questions.question: 19. If the value [1 a ; 1 c] = 0 then
questions.explanation: Det = a - c = 0, a=c, context suggests sum relation.
